intro: Acrolophia ustulata, commonly known as the fireblow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Acrolophia ustulata is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions and its ability to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
